intro: Chrysocephalum apiculatum subsp. racemosum, commonly known as the racemosum golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, yellowish-gold flowers that bloom in late summer to autumn. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a compact, bushy habit with narrow, gray-green leaves. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. The subspecies racemosum is distinguished by its racemose inflorescence, which forms a cylindrical or conical shape.
